actions-list.actionItem: The House adjourned. The next meeting is scheduled for 9:00 a.m. on February 7, 2025.
On motion to adjourn Agreed to by voice vote.
Mr. Kiley (CA) moved that the House do now adjourn.
The House has concluded all anticipated legislative business and has proceeded to Special Order speeches.
The House proceeded with further one minute speeches.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to without objection.
Considered as privileged matter. H. Res. 117 — "Electing a Member to a certain standing committee of the House of Representatives."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On passage Passed by the Yeas and Nays: 312
actions-list.actionItem: 108 (Roll no. 33).

actions-list.header: On agreeing to the Trahan amendment; Failed by the Yeas and Nays: 182
actions-list.actionItem: 226 (Roll no. 32).
Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 27 — "To amend the Controlled Substances Act with respect to the scheduling of fentanyl-related substances, and for other purposes."

The Chair announced that the unfinished business was the question on agreeing to the Trahan Amendment No. 2 to H.R. 27, and on passage of the bill, if ordered, which had been debated earlier and on which further proceedings had been postponed.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of February 6.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is subject to the call of the Chair.

At the conclusion of debate on the Trahan amendment No. 2, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the amendment and by voice vote, announced that the noes prevailed. Mrs. Trahan demanded the yeas and nays and the Chair postponed further proceeding until a time to be announced.
The previous question was ordered on the amendment and the bill pursuant to the rule.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 93, the House proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Trahan amendment No. 2.

An amendment, offered by Mrs. Trahan,  numbered 2 printed in Part B of House Report 119-2 to delay the enactment of this bill until the Secretary of Health and Human Services and the Attorney General each certify that the bill will lead to a reduction in overdose deaths.
The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H.R. 27.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 27 with 1 hour of general debate. Motion to recommit allowed. The resolution makes in order only the further amendment printed in Part B of the Rules Committee report.
Considered under the provisions of rule H. Res. 93. H.R. 27 — "To amend the Controlled Substances Act with respect to the scheduling of fentanyl-related substances, and for other purposes."
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of February 6.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess for a period of less than 15 minutes.
The House proceeded with one minute speeches, which by direction of the Chair would be limited to 15 per side of the aisle.
The Chair designated Mr. Harris of NC to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of February 6.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is scheduled for 12:00 P.M. today.
The House proceeded with Morning-Hour Debate. At the conclusion of Morning-Hour, the House will recess until 12:00 p.m. for the start of legislative business.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Mary E. Miller to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
